title: Did LBJ Advocate: ‘Convince the Lowest White Man He’s Better Than the Best Colored Man’?
subtitle: President Lyndon Baines Johnson, who grew up in the South and understood the politics of racism from the inside, saw it in part as a ploy to divide and conquer.
author: David Emery
vclaim: President Lyndon B. Johnson once said, "If you can convince the lowest white man he's better than the best colored man, he won't notice you're picking his pocket. Hell, give him somebody to look down on, and he'll empty his pockets for you."
